channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Russia downs 111 Ukrainian drones in three hours, defence ministry says
item.description: Russia's Defence Ministry said its air defence systems had intercepted and destroyed 111 Ukrainian drones in three hours over six Russian regions, including eight over Moscow. The capital's mayor Sergei Sobyanin said another batch of 11 drones were also later shot down en route to the city. Russi

item.title: 'A lot' can be decided ahead of Trump meeting: Zelensky
item.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Friday he planned to meet with US President Donald Trump soon and that a lot could be decided before the New Year as Washington pushes diplomatic efforts to end the war with Russia. Zelensky has said that sensitive issues, including any compromises on

item.title: Cyberattack disrupts France's postal service and banking during Christmas rush
item.description: With just three days to go before Christmas, a cyberattack knocked France’s national postal service offline Monday, blocking and delaying package deliveries and online payments. The timing was miserable for millions of people at the height of the Christmas season, as frazzled postal workers

item.title: Kremlin says US intelligence conclusions cited by Reuters 'not true'
item.description: The Kremlin said on Monday that US intelligence was wrong if it believed Russian President Vladimir Putin wanted to seize all of all Ukraine and parts of Europe that were once part of the former Soviet empire. Reuters cited six unidentified sources last week as saying US intelligence reports conti

item.title: Russian forces take Ukrainian villagers across border, media says
item.description: Russian forces have crossed the border with Ukraine in the northeastern Sumy region and taken about 50 residents of a Ukrainian border village into Russia, Ukrainian media quoted the military as saying on Sunday. Ukraine's public broadcaster Suspilne and the Ukrainska Pravda news outlet said Russi

item.title: Trump set to expand immigration crackdown in 2026 amid backlash
item.description: US President Donald Trump is preparing for a more aggressive immigration crackdown in 2026 with billions in new funding, including by raiding more workplaces — even as backlash builds ahead of next year’s midterm elections. Trump has already surged immigration agents into major US citi

item.title: Russia hits ports, bridge in escalating strikes on Ukraine's Odesa region
item.description: Russia attacked the southern Ukrainian port of Pivdennyi on Saturday, Ukrainian officials said, as it ramped up strikes on the Odesa region along the Black Sea including energy facilities and a critical route to the Moldova border. Russia has unleashed an almost continuous drone and missile campai

item.title: Ukraine welcomes €90bn EU loan, despite lack of deal on Russian assets
item.description: Ukraine thanked the European Union on Friday for deciding to provide it with 90 billion euros ($105.46 billion) of support over the next two years - even if the bloc failed to agree on an ambitious plan to finance it using frozen Russian assets. Russian President Vladimir Putin said the EU had bac

item.title: Putin sticks to Russian demands on Ukraine, says EU 'robbery' failed
item.description: President Vladimir Putin offered no compromise on Friday on his terms for ending the war in Ukraine and accused the European Union of attempting "daylight robbery" of Russian assets. As US President Donald Trump seeks an end to Europe's deadliest conflict since World War Two, Putin said the onus w

item.title: Lebanon-Israel truce committee talks widen
item.description: The committee overseeing the Hezbollah-Israel truce in Lebanon focused on Friday on how to return displaced people to their homes, addressing civilian issues to help prevent renewed war if a year-end deadline to disarm Hezbollah is not met. The 15th meeting of the committee reflected a long-standi

item.title: Ukraine clinches deal to restructure $2.6 billion in 'toxic' GDP warrants
item.description: Ukraine clinched a long-awaited deal to restructure $2.6 billion of growth-linked debt on Thursday, with creditors overwhelmingly accepting a bonds-and-cash swap offer - a key step for the country to emerge from sovereign default. Kyiv said holders of 99 per cent of the so-called GDP warrants had

item.title: UK welcomes EU funding agreement for Ukraine
item.description: British finance minister Rachel Reeves on Friday welcomed a decision by European Union leaders to loan 90 billion euros ($105 billion) to Ukraine to fund its defence against Russia. "I am pleased to see the agreement made today at the European Council to provide vital financial support for Ukraine

item.title: Spanish family missing after boat sinks off Indonesia
item.description: A Spanish family of four is missing after a boat carrying eleven people sank off the coast of Indonesia in extreme weather, Spanish authorities and an Indonesian news agency said on Saturday. The other passengers - two more tourists from Spain, four crew members and a tour guide - were all rescued

item.title: What lies ahead for Ukraine's contested Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant?
item.description: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest, is one of the main sticking points in US President Donald Trump's peace plan to end the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine. The issue is one of 20 points laid out by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in a framework peace pr

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign truce to halt fierce border conflict
item.description: Thailand and Cambodia agreed on Saturday to halt weeks of fierce border clashes, the worst fighting in years between the Southeast Asian countries that has included fighter jets sorties, exchange of rocket fire and artillery barrages. "Both sides agree to maintain current troop deployments without

item.title: Zelenskiy to hold talks with Trump on Sunday on ending Ukraine war
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy wants to discuss territorial issues, the main stumbling block in talks to end the war, with US President Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday, as a 20-point peace framework and a security guarantee deal near completion.
